title: Malala Yousafzai and Kailash Satyarthi win Nobel Peace prize | World news | The Guardian
summary: malala yousafzai and kailash satyarthi win the peace prize .

text: that 's it for now .
here 's a summary of the key points : malala yousafzai , the pakistani teenage education campaigner shot on school bus in 2012 by a taliban gunman , has won the 2014 nobel peace prize .
she was named as joint winner togethe with kailash satyarthi , an indian children 's rights activist .
at 17 malala is the youngest ever winner of a nobel prize .

the nobel committee said : despite her youth , malala yousafzai has already fought for several years for the right of girls to education , and has shown by example that children and young people , too , can contribute to improving their own situations . ''
malala is due give a statement after her school day in birmingham .
satyarthi said prize was a great moment for all those children '' who have been deprived of their childhood by being forced into work .
he added : everyone must acknowledge that child labour still exists in the world in its ugliest form it must go . ''
the joint award has been greeted with widespread approval from world leaders .
those expressing congratulations included the leaders of india , pakistan , germany and france , as well as the queen .
the family of mahatma gandhi , the most notable absentee on the list of previous winners , also expressed its approval .
the nobel committee singled out satyarthi for maintaining gandhi 's tradition . ''
the queen does n't usually comment on nobel prizes , but she has on this occasion .
britishmonarchy ( @ britishmonarchy ) warm congratulations to malala yousafzai & kailash satyarthi for winning the # nobelpeaceprize
sahiba , 17 , is just one of the thousands of young trafficked girls rescued by satyarthi 's organisation , save the childhood , writes anu anand in new delhi .
originally from assam , sahiba 's mother died when she was six months old and her father was paralysed by a work-related accident .
unable to get along with the aunts and cousins who looked after her , sahiba decided to run away to delhi with a family friend who promised to marry her into a good home .

i met him at the bus station with a bag packed with some clothes , '' sahiba said , narrating her ordeal recently in a windowless meeting room in save the childhood 's modest headquarters in a congested neighbourhood of new delhi .
when we got near delhi , he raped me twice .
he told me , 'it 's alright , i 'm your brother . ' ''
sahiba was then sold into marriage to a young man , ikram , who suffered mental difficulties . ''
sahiba added : he looked nice and i could n't speak hindi , so i did n't really understand and i thought i 'd better say yes or i 'd be raped again . ''
it was only a month later that sahiba overheard her new sister in law talking about how the family had paid £ 130 for her .
infuriated , she demanded to go home .
but they told me they had borrowed the money to buy me and now they owned me , so i could n't leave . ''
over the few months , sahiba was subjected to rapes and beatings by her husband 's family .
sometimes , other villagers joined in the thrashings .
once , her sister-in-law attacked her with a knife .
there is no fear when it comes to marrying underage girls , '' satyarthi explained .
child marriage is so common , so much the cultural norm in different parts of india that the community accepts that a girl is being bought for marriage . ''

sahiba eventually managed to call her brother back in assam , and with save the childhood 's help , he convinced police in the town of palwal , haryana , where she was being held , just 60 kilometres from the corridors of power in new delhi , to act .

a rescue video shot by activists with satyarthi 's organisation shows firstly how reluctant police were to intervene , arguing that it was a private family matter and that police from sahiba 's home state of assam , more than 1700 km away , should investigate .
after hours of negotiations , during which save the childhood 's lawyers and activists schooled the local police inspector on india 's laws against trafficking , they reluctantly decided to act .
sahiba was rescued later that day and spirited away even as angry villagers chased her car , angry at being robbed of what they saw as their rightful property .

i still suffer pain from those beatings , '' said sahiba , who now lives in new delhi and is being helped by satyarthi 's organisation to receive government compensation for being trafficked is trying to start a new life .
from the start , i felt what was happening was wrong , but without my brother and the activists ' help , i would still be there , living like a slave . ''
malala is expected to make a statement at 4.30pm after classes finish at edgbaston high school for girls in birmingham , pa confirms .
she is also expected to record an interview with the nobel organisers .
the nobel prize ( @ nobelprize ) stay tuned - we are hoping to get an interview with malala yousafzai soon .
# nobelprize2014 # peace her relatives have said they can not express the level of our happiness in words '' after this morning 's announcement , pa reports .
malala 's first cousin mehmood ul hassan , the administrator of khushal public school where she studied before being shot , said the whole family was delighted she had received the award .
hassan said he had spoken to malala and her parents , telling the telegraph that they are all very excited and happy about this '' .
malala told me that allah has blessed her with this award and she hopes this peace prize will help her cause ( of educating girls ) , which is what she is focused on , '' he said .
the nobel committee said it was an important point for a hindu and a muslim , an indian and a pakistani , to join in a common struggle for education and against extremism '' .
mahatma gandhi 's family has expressed its approval , writes jason burke in delhi .
tushar gandhi , the great grandson of the globally revered proponent of non-violent protest and independence leader , said the new nobel laureates continued gandhi 's example .

malala personifies non-violent resistance admirably too and both she and kailash satyarthi also personify the commitment and solidarity that was the legacy of the work of all the illustrious leaders of [ indian ] independence movement , '' gandhi said .
until yesterday no politician was bothered or was interested in what he was doing and some were even irritated by him , now they will all sing his paeans .
i think my great grandfather with his sense of humour would have laughed he had long realised the hypocrisy of politicians . ''
many have been struck by the committee 's emphasis on the faiths of the two winners .
it 's weird this equation of indian and hindu and pakistani and muslim frankly lowers the award , '' said shekhar gupta , one of india 's best known print journalists .
it shows a complete lack of understanding of the complexities and nuances of the sub-continent .
i knew kailash [ satyarthi ] a long time back and remember him as a fairly atheist . ''
gupta added : that said .
it 's a wonderful thing .
at least they [ india and pakistan ] might stop firing for a couple of hours . ''
recent days have seen one of the worst outbreaks of violence on the border between india and pakistan for a decade with around 20 killed and tens of thousands displaced by artillery barrages .
india 's home minister rajnath singh congratulated satyarthi and malala yusufzai : shri kailash satyarthi is a champion of child rights whose work is now recognised internationally .
congratulations to him once again . ''
he also tweeted : malala yousufzai 's spirited fight for education to girls in pakistan has inspired many in south asia .
congratulations to her !
satyarthi will meet newly elected prime minister narendra modi this evening .
mahatma gandhi in 1930
the head of the nobel institute has hinted that some members of the committee were reluctant to give malala because of her age .
at the end of his interview lundestad suggested he himself was anxious that the award would put too much pressure on her .
he said : we waited .
we did not give malala the noble peace prize last year .
the committee took its time .
we have seen her in action throughout the world .
the committee has been remarkably impressed how she has been able , despite her young age , to speak and have a tremendous impact people are incredibly moved by malala .
so we took our time but we are very optimistic that this will work out well .
of course , its true , she 's a girl , she 's 17-years-old and this will dramatically change her life and we hope for the better .
india 's prime minster narenda modi tweeted that the whole india is proud of satyarthi 's award .
narendra modi ( @ narendramodi ) congratulations to shri kailash satyarthi on being awarded the nobel peace prize .
the entire nation is proud of his momentous achievement .
he also praised malala 's grit and courage '' .
narendra modi ( @ narendramodi ) malala yousafzai 's life is a journey of immense grit & courage .
i congratulate her on being awarded the nobel peace prize .
french president francois hollande reaffirmed his government 's to protect children 's rights .
he praised malala 's immense courage '' and satyarthi 's obstinate action '' .
élysee ( @ elysee ) le president @ twitterid salue le choix de decerner le prix nobel de la paix a malala yousafzai et @ twitterid satyarthi
satyarthi said the prize was a great honour '' .
interviewed by the nobel prize committee he said it was great moment for all those children '' who have been deprived of their childhood by being forced into work .
satyarthi added that the award was an honour for india and would be spur to campaigners for the rights of children .
he said : everyone must acknowledge that child labour still exists in the world in its ugliest form it must go . ''

documents.title: malala 's reaction
text: update : earlier we stated that malala had broken her silence in a brief tweet expressing her thanks .
it has now emerged that this was a fake account .
her official reaction is expected at 4.30pm bst .
malala fund ( @ malalafund ) malala will make her first statement after school at 16.30/uk on her and @ twitterid satyarthi being honored with # nobelpeaceprize .
geir lundestan , the director of the nobel institute , said the committee did not tell malala about the prize before the announcement as a precaution against the winning names being leaked .
we felt that if we called malala in advance the news would become known immediately , '' he said .
the committee tried to contact satyarthi , he said , but it did n't work out . ''
he said : we have n't spoken with either of laureates . ''

in an interview broadcast on the nobel prize website said the winners would be seen as uncontroversial in scandinavia , but it would be seen as challenging in parts of the world where child labour is still used , including india and pakistan .
he revealed that it took seven meetings of the committee to reach agreement on the joint winners .
we did reach a decision fairly late , but we are happy with the outcome . ''
lundestad said he hoped that malala 's win would underline the importance of female education in the muslim world .
satyarthi features in this sky news clip on efforts to tackle child slavery in india .
he says those who continue to buy goods made by child labour are responsible for the perpetuation of child slavery .
these products are made from the sweat and blood of children , in slavery , '' he says in the clip .
more international reaction : kofi annan ( @ kofiannan ) there is no tool for development more effective than the empowerment of women .
congratulations malala & @ twitterid satyarthi .

ka # nobelprize2014 tony blair office ( @ tonyblairoffice ) fantastic news , @ twitterid and @ twitterid rightly honoured for their inspirational work # nobelprize2014 herman van rompuy ( @ euhvr ) i honour # nobelprize2014 winners kailash satyarthi & malala yousafzay for their crucial work on children 's rights :
satyarthi has freed tens of thousands of indian children forced into slavery , afp reports in profile of the joint nobel winner .
born on january 11 , 1954 , satyarthi has been at the forefront of the drive against child labour in india where the practice is rife .
satyarthi , who was trained as an electrical engineer , founded the bachpan bachao andolan or save the childhood movement in 1980 .
he lives modestly and keeps a low profile except for his causes .

the activist , born in the central indian state of madhya pradesh , said he was delighted '' by the nobel award , according to the press trust of india , and described it as recognition '' for the fight for child rights .
he began his work by staging raids on indian manufacturing , rug-making and other plants where children and their parents often work as bonded labour .
under bonded labour , families often borrow money and have to work till the funds can be repaid .
but often the money is too much to be paid back from meagre earnings and people are sold and resold .

building on his initial activism , satyarthi organised the global march against child labour in the 1990s - dedicated to freeing the millions of children abused worldwide in a form of modern slavery .
to employ children is illegal and unethical , '' satyarthi said on the global march against child labour website .
if not now , then when ?
if not you , then who ?
if we are able to answer these fundamental questions , then perhaps we can wipe away the blot of human slavery , '' satyarthi said , summing up his philosophy .
the activist is also founder of rugmark , a widely known international scheme that tags all carpets made in factories that are child-labour free .
he described the plight of children forced into the worst kinds of abusive work in a 2010 interview with the robert f. kennedy centre for justice and human rights .
if they cry for their parents , they are beaten severely , sometimes hanged upside down from trees and even branded or burned with cigarettes , '' he said .
he also spearheads the south asian coalition on child servitude or saacs , among other groups , and helps oversee a transition centre in rajasthan where newly freed labourers learn fresh skills .
satyarthi has said his social conscience was awoken when he was six and noticed a boy his age on the steps outside the school with his father , cleaning shoes .
seeing many such children working instead of being educated , he felt an urge as he grew older to solve the problem - launching him on his career of activism .
i think of it all as a test .
this is a moral examination that one has to pass .
to stand up against such social evils , '' he said in the kennedy centre interview .
ilo ( @ ilo ) congratulations to nobel peace laureate kailash satyarthi , a true champion in the fight to end child labour .
nico hines , from the daily beast , reckons malala will be making a brief statement when her school day is finished .
nico hines ( @ nicohines ) malala is at school today .
she 's going to make a short speech about her historic achievement at home time .
the bbc 's policy editor chris cook wonders whether malala 's school will get special footnote in the next year 's league tables .
chris cook ( @ xtophercook ) does edgbaston high school win an asterisk in league tables ?
`` average 837 points per 6th form pupil , one nobel prize ''
perhaps malala is too busy studying in birmingham to react to winning the nobel peace prize .
in august she told the observer that she a strict rue about taking time off school .
i will only miss school for an engagement if it is going to bring real change , '' she says .

that is the question i have to ask myself with each request and if the answer is yes , i say , 'ok , i will sacrifice one day of my school for the education of millions of children who are out of school . ' ''
in the beginning she said yes to many , many '' invitations .
but then i realised my studies were being affected . ''
she is determined to get straight as next year , before going on to do a-levels .
i 'm going to choose the arts subjects , '' she says .
definitely not the sciences . ''
the bbc 's shaima khalil has the reaction from a girls ' school in islamabad .

shaimaa khalil ( @ shaimaakhalil ) big smiles and cheers at # islamabad college for girls when they heard the news of # malala 's # nobelpeaceprize # pakistan guantanamo chief prosecutor colonel morris davis makes a pointed dig at barack obama .
col. morris davis ( @ colmorrisdavis ) i 'll go out on a limb & say 2014 # nobelpeaceprize winner , unlike 2009 winner , wo n't launch drones or make kill lists .
there 's been no reaction yet from malala .
while we wait , this was her first broadcast interview after being shot by the taliban .
and in an interview a year ago she explained why she became an activist .
angela merkel 's spokesman , steffen seibert , said the joint award is boost for all those who campaign for the rights of children .
steffen seibert ( @ regsprecher ) nobelpreis für # malala yousafzai + kailash satyarthi ist große ermutigung für alle , die s. für kinderrechte weltweit einsetzen .
glückwunsch !

documents.title: reaction in pakistan
text: news of malala 's win is bitter sweet for pakistan , writes saba imtiaz in karachi .
congratulatory messages came in from the pakistani prime minister nawaz sharif , as well as a slew of other politicians .
but there is sadness amongst many in pakistan that malala is n't in pakistan to celebrate this , and that she was nearly killed for her work advocating education for children .
there 's also a bitter sense of irony that malala , like pakistan 's first nobel laureate theoretical physicist dr abdus salam , has been the subject of a campaign of vilification in pakistan .
dr salam has been virtually forgotten in pakistan because he was a member of the ahmadiyya sect , which has been excommunicated in pakistan , and malala has been accused of selling out to the west .

liaquat baloch , a leader of the jamaat-e-islami , a right-wing religious-political party , told the guardian that malala is a pakistani student and she is getting a lot of support and patronage abroad .

on the surface this is not a bad thing and we welcome this , and there is no objection to the award , but the attack on malala and then her support in the west creates a lot of sus there are lots of girls in pakistan who have been martyred in terrorist attacks , women who have been widowed , but no one gives them an award .
so these out of the box activities are sus
satyarthi dedicated the prize to children in slavery , reuters reports citing an cnn interview .

it 's an honour to all those children who are still suffering in slavery , bonded labour and trafficking , '' satyarthi told news channel cnn-ibn/ satyarthi , 60 , founded bachpan bachao andolan - or save the childhood movement - in 1980 and has acted to protect the rights of 80,000 children .
it 's an honour to all my fellow indians .
i am thankful to all those who have been supporting my striving for more than the last 30 years , '' said satyarthi .
the peace prize was shared between india and pakistan amid intense crossfire on the frontier of the disputed territory of kashmir .
in his initial reaction , satyarthi made no reference either to the conflict or to malala .
a lot of credit goes to the indians who fight to keep democracy so alive and so vibrant , where i was able to keep my fight on , '' said satyarthi .
something which was born in india has gone globally and now we have the global movement against child labour .
after receiving this award i feel that people will give more attention to the cause of children in the world . ''
a file taken in 1999 shows kailash satyarthi , indian anti-child labour activist and head of the south asian coalition against child servitude , addressesing a press conference in new delhi .
raveendran/afp/getty images
the eu , the un , more world leaders , and british politicians have been tweeting congratulations .

eu external action ( @ eu eeas ) # nobelpeaceprize goes to # malalayousafzai & # kailashsatyarthi for respective work for # childrensrights # education4all united nations ( @ un ) `` one child , one teacher , one book & one pen can change the world . ''

malala yousafzai at the @ twitterid : # nobelprize2014 presidence mali ( @ presidencemali ) mali | prix nobel de la paix 2014 : le president # ibk adresse ses chaleureuses felicitations a # yousafzaymalala et a # kailashsatyarthi matteo renzi ( @ matteorenzi ) complimenti a malala nobel per la pace , che all'onu disse `` abbiamo capito l'importanza delle penne e dei libri quando abbiamo visto le armi '' sadiq khan mp ( @ sadiqkhan ) can not think of a more deserving winner of the nobel peace prize on today , the international day of the girl # idg2014 .
well done malala justine greening ( @ justinegreening ) congratulations to malala on her @ twitterid for peace .
shows how one teenage girl with a voice can give hope to millions more @ twitterid
britain 's former prime minister gordon brown , who paid tribute to malala at a un event last year , said that she and satyarthi are the world 's greatest children 's champions '' .

in a statement he said : they are two of my best friends and two of the greatest global campaigners who deserve the nobel peace prize for their courage , determination and for their vision that no child should ever be left behind and that every child should have the best of chances .

kailash 's life-long work in india fighting child labour - which i have had the privilege to see at first hand complements malala 's work standing up for girls ' rights to education from pakistan to the rest of the world .

both are members of the emergency coalition for global education that graca machel , nelson mandela 's widow and i have the honour of chairing and their deep-seated commitment to children 's rights will ensure that no injustice can last forever .
malala yousafzai speaking with gordon brown before her speech at the united nations headquarters in new york .
bajornas/un photo/pa

documents.title: satyarthi : 'extremely delighted '
text: satyarthi said he is extremely delighted '' to have been given the honour , according to the press trust of india .
he said it was a recognition of the fight for children 's rights .
press trust of india ( @ pti news ) extremely delighted .
this is recognition of our fight for child rights , kailash satyarthi , nobel peace prize awardee , to pti .
press trust of india ( @ pti news ) i am thankful to nobel committee for recognising the plight of millions of children who are suffering in this modern age : satyarthi .
press trust of india ( @ pti news ) the honour is for all the citizens of india .
i will continue my work for welfare of children : satyarthi .
britain 's deputy prime minister nick clegg has congratulated the joint winners .
nick clegg ( @ nick clegg ) thoroughly deserved nobel peace prize awarded to kailash satyarthi and malala yousafzai .
excellent day for children 's rights and education other front line british politicians have focused on malala .
lynne featherstone ( @ lfeatherstone ) congratulations to @ twitterid on winning the nobel peace prize .
her work highlights how critical girls ' education is worldwide .
mary creagh mp ( @ marycreagh mp ) wonderful news.congratulations @ twitterid , youngest winner of @ twitterid 4 your courage in campaigning 4 girls education # bringbackourgirls
it will come as no surprise that guardian readers thought that edward snowden should have won .
the whistleblower won our readers ' poll .
poll of guardian readers guardian
here 's the full text of jagland 's announcement of this year 's joint winners .
note that the committee deliberately selected both a muslim and a hindu .
it also cited mahatma gandhi perhaps trying to make amends for the most famous omission on the list of previous winners .

the norwegian nobel committee has decided that the nobel peace prize for 2014 is to be awarded to kailash satyarthi and malala yousafzay for their struggle against the suppression of children and young people and for the right of all children to education .
children must go to school and not be financially exploited .
in the poor countries of the world , 60 % of the present population is under 25 years of age .
it is a prerequisite for peaceful global development that the rights of children and young people be respected .
in conflict-ridden areas in particular , the violation of children leads to the continuation of violence from generation to generation .

showing great personal courage , kailash satyarthi , maintaining gandhi 's tradition , has headed various forms of protests and demonstrations , all peaceful , focusing on the grave exploitation of children for financial gain .
he has also contributed to the development of important international conventions on children 's rights .

despite her youth , malala yousafzay has already fought for several years for the right of girls to education , and has shown by example that children and young people , too , can contribute to improving their own situations .
this she has done under the most dangerous circumstances .
through her heroic struggle she has become a leading spokesperson for girls ' rights to education .
the nobel committee regards it as an important point for a hindu and a muslim , an indian and a pakistani , to join in a common struggle for education and against extremism .
many other individuals and institutions in the international community have also contributed .
it has been calculated that there are 168 million child labourers around the world today .
in 2000 the figure was 78 million higher .
the world has come closer to the goal of eliminating child labour .

the struggle against suppression and for the rights of children and adolescents contributes to the realization of the fraternity between nations '' that alfred nobel mentions in his will as one of the criteria for the nobel peace prize .
yemeni nobel peace laureate tawakkol karman said yousafzai and satyarthi were worthy winners .
توكل كرمان ( @ tawakkolkarman ) بحيازتك بطلتي ملالا لجائزةنوبل تؤكدين أن الإسلام دين للمحبةوالسلام،وأن أمته عامل مهم للتعايش والقبول والسلام العالمي2
norway 's prime minister , erna solberg , is the first world leader to tweet her congratulations .
erna solberg ( @ erna solberg ) nobel peace prize awarded to kailash satyarthi and @ twitterid yousafzai for their important work to secure education for children .
congrats !
ap has this quick take on the announcement of the joint winners .
children 's rights activists malala yousafzai of pakistan and kailash satyarthi of india were awarded the nobel peace prize friday .
the norwegian nobel committee cited the two for their struggle against the suppression of children and young people and for the right of all children to education .
`` yousafzai , now 17 , is a schoolgirl and education campaigner in pakistan who was shot in the head by a taliban gunman two years ago .

satyarthi , 60 , has maintained the tradition of mahatma gandhi and headed various forms of peaceful protests , focusing on the grave exploitation of children for financial gain , '' the nobel committee said .
the nobel committee said it regards it as an important point for a hindu and a muslim , an indian and a pakistani , to join in a common struggle for education and against extremism . ''

the founder of the nobel prizes , swedish industrialist alfred nobel , said the prize committee should give the prize to the person who shall have done the most or the best work for fraternity between nations , for the abolition or reduction of standing armies and for the holding and promotion of peace congresses . ''
the committee has interpreted those instructions differently over time , widening the concept of peace work to include efforts to improve human rights , fight poverty and clean up the environment .
at 17 malala yousafzai has become the youngest ever winner of the nobel peace prize .
the nobel prize ( @ nobelprize ) 17 yrs malala yousafzay is the youngest nobel laureate ever , lawrence bragg ( physics 1915 ) was 25 when awarded the prize with his father .
nobel peace prize winners malala yousafzai and kailash satyarthi .
de paola for the guardian/corbis
here 's video of the announcement
the nobel prize ( @ nobelprize ) breaking news : the # nobelprize2014 in peace is awarded to indian kailash satyarthi and pakistani malala yousafzay

documents.title: malala yousafzai and kailash satyarthi win the peace prize
text: and the winners are malala yousafzai and kailash satyarthi
not long now .
the nobel prize ( @ nobelprize ) prof. lundestad gives a few last minute instructions to global media .
announcement to begin shortly .
# nobelprize2014
the norwegian broadcaster , nrk , reckons the prize could be heading for tunisia , afp reports .

the broadcaster , which sometimes but not always has been able to predict the winner , wrote on its website that tunisia 's powerful ugtt workers union and president moncef marzouki were among this year 's favourites .
union can beat out malala tomorrow , '' it wrote on its website .
the ugtt was nominated for its role in tunisia 's democratic transition , brokering political negotiations that resulted in a post-revolution constitution being signed .
marzouki , a secular ally of the moderate islamist party ennahda , was chosen as president in tunisia 's first election since dictator zine el abidine was toppled in 2011 .
wikileaks has some last minute lobbying for chelsea manning .
wikileaks ( @ wikileaks ) only one person must win the nobel peace prize today .
chelsea manning who is serving 35 years in the us for exposing 100s of war crimes .
and un insiders have been lobbying for general secretary ban ki-moon to get the prize , according to un blogger matthew russell lee .
sources close to ban tell inner city press it is another of its advisers , terje roed-larsen , who has promised ban a nobel '' or consideration for it , if not this year then before his tenure ends .
if ban receives it , it will not be based on having made peace , but rather for work on climate change , or perhaps what are called the post-2015 development goals . ''
on the positive side , ban has linked himself and the un with combating climate change .

during the recently concluded un general debate , while most leaders focused on the threats to peace and security posed by islamic state , or the situation in eastern ukraine or the failed or reversed arab spring , ban convened a climate change summit in terms of mediating disputes and being an impartial voice in favor of peace , however , ban has been less successful .
the nobel website has a live feed of the announcement .
and you follow the announcement on the committee 's twitter feed .
it is the nobel prize that has the most attention and most prestige , despite being awarded to some of the most bizarre , uninspiring and controversial winners .
yes , the nobel prize week culminates this morning with the peace prize .
the winner of the £ 690,000 ( $ 1.1m ) prize will be named by the chairman of the nobel committee , norway 's former prime minister thorbjørn jagland , at 11am local time ( 10am bst ) .
there have been a record 278 nominations this year , 19 more than the previous high .
the nominations that have been made public by their sponsors are as eclectic and provocative as some of the previous winners .
they include a clause in the japanese constitution and 47 organisations , including the international space station partnership .
edward snowden .
guardian/afp/getty there are also some politically charged nominees including the us whistleblowers edward snowden and chelsea manning .
both are serious contenders , at least with the bookmakers .
less serious in terms of odds , is russia 's belligerent president , who has also been nominated .
vladimir putin 's name was put forward before he was widely criticised for stoking violence in ukraine and annexing crimea .

the nobel committee does have some safer options to chose from including pope francis and last year 's favourite , malala yousafzai , the pakistani teenage education campaigner shot on school bus in 2012 by a taliban gunman .
pope francis /rex the pope is the current favourite with the bookies william hill , which puts snowden on 8-1 as joint third favourite with the un secretary general , ban ki-moon .
the christian science monitor ( csm ) explains why snowden is unlikely to win .
the nobel committee prides itself on its independence , but it is chosen by norway 's parliament and is made up of former politicians who are aware of the political ramifications of their decisions .
giving it to snowden would run against all political instincts .
he is , after all , considered a traitor to one of norway 's closest allies , '' kristian harpviken , director at the peace research institute in oslo , told the csm .
carmen fishwick has a guide to some of this year 's runners and riders , and guardian correspondents have put together their list of nominees .
it is impossible to know what kind of mood committee members are in .
previous choices include such illustrious names as nelson mandela , aung san suu kyi , and martin luther king jr. henry kissinger .
however , henry kissinger is also a nobel peace laureate , after he reached a peace agreement in vietnam , despite his record as one of the most hawkish us secretaries of state .
under jagland 's chairmanship , the committee has chosen a high number of contentious winners .
its decision to give the award to the chinese dissident liu xiaobo infuriated beijing .
jagland memorably presented the award to an empty chair in 2010 as xiaobo was behind bars .
norway 's trade with china has declined since .

the chairman of the norwegian nobel committee , thorbjørn jagland , looks at the certificate and medal on the empty chair where the 2010 peace prize winner , jailed chinese dissident liu xiaobo , would have sat .
norway/reuters and jagland committee 's first choice was seen as an act of wishful thinking when it awarded the prize to barack obama in his first year of office .
it looks even odder in hindsight as the us president has since launched multiple military campaigns in the middle east .
last year 's choice of the organisation for the prohibition of chemical weapons was similarly optimistic .
at the time , the agency 's role in overseeing the destruction of syria 's chemical arsenal offered a slim chance of finding a diplomatic resolution to the crisis engulfing the country .
but the violence in syria has only got worse , and there are continuing concerns that the bashar al-assad regime is concealing its stockpile of chemical weapons .
in 2012 the nobel committee prompted a collective 'huh ? '
when the prize went to the european union .
it is unlikely that the committee will select an organisation for a third year in row .
but who knows ?
we do n't have long to wait and this blog will be tracking the announcement as it happens and following all the reaction .

10.01am BST
10:01
Malala Yousafzai and Kailash Satyarthi win the peace prize

bulletin.text: Indian and Pakistani children campaigners win 2014 peace prize.
